title: The Man Who Knew Too Much

sources.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much (1934) O Homem Que Sabia Demais
sources.description: O Homem Que Sabia Demais (The Man Who Knew Too Much - 1934) legendado pt-br

sources.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much (1934)
sources.description: An ordinary British couple vacationing in Switzerland suddenly find themselves embroiled in a case of international intrigue when their daughter is kidnapped by spies plotting a political assassination.

sources.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much (1934) Leslie Banks, Edna Best, Peter Lorre | Hitchcock Thriller
sources.description:
Public Enemy No. 1 of all the world...
While vacationing in St. Moritz, a British couple receive a clue to an imminent assassination attempt, only to learn that their young daughter has been kidnapped to keep them quiet.

Original title: The Man Who Knew Too Much (1934)
B&W version https://youtu.be/gDt2qK_ZNQk

Director: Alfred Hitchcock
Writers: Charles Bennett, D.B. Wyndham-Lewis, Edwin Greenwood

Main cast:

Edna Best – Jill Lawrence
Peter Lorre – Abbott
Nova Pilbeam – Betty Lawrence
Frank Vosper – Ramon Levine

Pierre Fresnay – Louis Bernard

D.A. Clarke‑Smith – Binstead
George Curzon – Gibson

Costumes: Edith Head
Genres: Crime, Mystery, Thriller, Film-Noir
Release date: 9 December 1934 (UK)
Filming location: London,
Budget: £40,000 (estimated)

metadata.Plot: While holidaying in Switzerland, Bob Lawrence and his wife Jill are asked by a dying friend, Louis Bernard, to get information hidden in his room to the British Consulate. They obtain the information, but when they deny having it their daughter Betty is kidnapped. It turns out that Louis was a Foreign Office spy and the information has to do with the assassination of a foreign dignitary. Having managed to trace his daughter's kidnappers back to London, Bob learns that the assassination will take place during a concert at the Albert Hall. It is left to Jill, however, to stop the assassination.
metadata.Writer: Charles Bennett, D.B. Wyndham-Lewis, Edwin Greenwood
metadata.Actors: Leslie Banks, Edna Best, Peter Lorre
